Kenneth Lou, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 14 Sep 2018Yo hey there! Definitely a Legitimate app. I've been using it for over a year now? Decent so far, you can see what other people's returns are so far also haha.​Your question may be whether they have the correct licence etc. which I can share with you here!​The next question is whether others have been using it, which you can read user reviews: https://seedly.sg/reviews/robo-advisors/stashaway and also the team profile here: https://seedly.sg/profile/stashawayHistory: Started in 2016 by ex ZALORA Group CEO, Michele Ferrario and ex Nomura MD, Freddy LimFunding: $4m+ with investors including high net worth angels and Francis Rozario (from CITI)Operation: Under MAS Capital Market Services Licence (CMS100604-1)Methodology: A proprietary investment strategy called the Economic Regime-based Asset Allocation (ERAA) which continually monitors economic and market cycles to rebalances accordinglyUser Interface: Adopting a modern interface similar to Betterment (USA) with simple goals, charts, and visualsPricing: Between 0.8% ($25k) to 0.2% ($1M) of total invested per year (No Minimum to start) 0 comments1

MasterAnswered on 15 Sep 2018Hi~ Yes, it's a legitimate app to use for setting up portfolio  and I've been trying it out for say 6months at least? So far it's well catered to my risk appetited and I'm at +3%. There are many reviews for the stashaway app which you can refer to under product review section; but as a new user to investment I find that it was really intuitive and easy to understand.​No big terms, no big initial lump sum investment. Choose your risk appetite, your comfortable range of investment and know how the basket is distributed. That said, deposit and withdrawslas are flexible; giving me peace of mind.0 comments0
